title: PDF → Text Converter
subtitle: Upload a PDF file to extract text, edit it directly, and download it in your preferred format — plain text (.txt).

funFacts.title: The Birth of PDF
funFacts.description: The idea of a universal document format was developed by Adobe co-founder John Warnock in 1991 as part of the Camelot project.

funFacts.title: Official Release
funFacts.description: The PDF specification and the first version of Adobe Acrobat were publicly released in 1993, making PDFs widely accessible.

funFacts.title: PDF is Everywhere
funFacts.description: Over 2.5 trillion PDFs are estimated to exist globally today.

funFacts.title: Universal Format
funFacts.description: PDFs are designed to look identical across all platforms and devices — that’s why they’re perfect for sharing.

funFacts.title: Editable Magic
funFacts.description: Converting a PDF to editable text makes it easier to repurpose, annotate, or translate documents.

funFacts.title: Flexible Output
funFacts.description: TXT files provide clean, simple content.
